**Special Containment Procedures:** Given the lack of available information concerning SCP-6848's nature, containment procedures for the object itself cannot currently be devised. The object is presumed self-containing, and has been afforded the Safe classification.

Whenever possible, the Foundation is to monitor and regulate any extraterrestrial craft entering and exiting Earth's atmosphere within the maximum possible range of SCP-6848. This is to be accomplished from secure containment Site-51 in collaboration with the United States federal government. For Veil preservation purposes, interplanetary transit in the southwestern United States is to be limited to a select number of approved spaceports. The list of ports in question must be unanimously agreed upon by the administrative council of Site-51, composed of a Foundation site director and the members of the MJ-12.

Negotiations are underway with non-hostile extraterrestrial civilizations, with the objective of having said civilizations willingly reduce their presence on Earth to Site-51 and associated spaceports so as to respect Earth's Veil preservation policies in exchange for scientific collaboration with the Foundation and Pentagram.

**Description:** SCP-6848 is an extremely antimemetic object presumably located somewhere in or beneath the southwestern United States. Due to SCP-6848's potent anomalous property, no other information concerning its size, shape, capabilities, purpose, identity, or any other element of its nature can be ascertained.

[[div class="limit"]] 
[[div class="anchor"]] 
[[div class="sidebox"]]

[[=]]
+++ Site-51 Status Report and Overview of Policy History
++++ Address to the O4 Courts by Director M. Posadas, 2018

[[image https://i.imgur.com/oOl46sj.png]]

[[/=]]



It would be easy to assume that the misinformation staff at Site-51 have experienced some sort of catastrophic failure. After all, ask any Veiled conspiracy theorist -- any casual UFO enthusiast or Parawatch regular -- and they'll give you the same story; a story that isn't far from the truth of what occurs at the site, involving extraterrestrial paratechnology and some vague conspiracy by the federal government of the United States.

Though you would be forgiven for making such an assumption, it would be dead wrong.

Site-51 policy serves as a lesson in soft power when it comes to Veil enforcement. Every absurd conspiracy theory you've ever heard about so-called "Area 51", we wanted you to hear. We engineered them to be absurd; disseminated them with careful thought and deliberation. And, after years of close collaboration with the Disinfo Department's best and brightest, we've came up with a formula for strategic misinformation that we believe can be of great use to the rest of the Foundation. After all, in a great many cases dealing with the anomalous, billions spent on mass amnesticization, media manipulation, and rewriting history seem wasted when one can instead simply trick the public by making the things hidden from them seem so absurd, so conspiratorial and crackpot, so laughably outlandish -- that [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6460 | nobody bothers to look into them seriously]]].

It isn't just a reduced need for a Veil budget that covers our paratech research, though. Site-51 is known for its collaboration, and not just in-house collaboration with our friends at M&D[[footnote]]Department of Misinformation and Disinformation[[/footnote]]. As you all know, the Site is co-owned with the American government, which uses it -- much as we do -- primarily for experimental paratech testing and as a base for extraterrestrial relations. //Technically//, their neck of the woods is called the "Nevada Test and Training Range", and ours is called "Secure Research & Development Facility-51"; Site-51 is the union of these two coinciding facilities. Makes more sense to have a single term, they're in the same complex after all. Decisions relevant to the entire site are made by an administrative council representing both parties[[footnote]]Composed of a Foundation site director and twelve Pentagram representatives (sometimes called the "MJ-12"), with each side controlling 50% of the vote collectively. A plebiscite of Site personnel is used as a tiebreaking vote, if necessary.[[/footnote]]. Despite our sometimes mixed relationship with the USA over the years, this collaboration has endured. It represents a relationship between Site-51 and the Pentagram Southwestern Command that lasted through the [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/pickman-blank-proposal |Panopticon Crisis]]], the affairs of the [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/resurrection |Bowe Commission]]], and every other squabble had between our parent organizations from 1955 to present.

Basically, it is only through collaboration -- be it with our own M&D Department, with the Pentagram, or even with the extraterrestrial Groups of Interest with which Site-51 negotiates -- that allows our site to exist. That allows us to reverse-engineer paratech and distribute the fruits of that labor to other Secure Containment Facilities and Departments. And that is why, fellow Site Directors, honorable Chairwoman of the Committee, I urge you to vote today not for isolation, but for further collaboration and integration; both within our own organization and with our allies, wherever in the world -- wherever in the //galaxy// -- they may reside.

[[/div]]
[[/div]]
Due to their high level of involvement in the region surrounding SCP-6848 in addition to first-hand accounts, it is believed that SCP-6848 is an artifact of extreme importance to a number of extraterrestrial civilizations across the Milky Way galaxy. Frequent attempts to seek out and obtain the object by said civilizations have resulted in a swell of extraterrestrial activity in the southwestern United States, with 72% of appearances of unidentified extraterrestrial craft in North America occurring in the area. The first known mission in modern history by organisms of extra-planetary origin to seek out SCP-6848 crash landed in Roswell, New Mexico in 1947, causing a major normalcy-endangering incident (see Addendum 1).
[[/div]] 

@@ @@

[[include component:image-block
| name=https://i.imgur.com/reF9GLA.png
| align=center
| width=500px
| height=200px
| caption=Above: Map of U.S. counties deemed within the region of SCP-6848, which account for 72% of UFO sightings in North America. Darker reds indicate a higher frequency of sightings.
]]

When contact has been established with extraterrestrial expeditions attempting to locate SCP-6848, the contacted party, if communicative, is universally able to explain the importance of the object as understood by them and their reasons for their seeking it out[[footnote]]These reasons are often contradictory and vastly differ based on the species and group affiliation of the contacted party. However, almost all contacted expeditions universally view SCP-6848 as of high import in some way.[[/footnote]]. However, all information in such messages pertaining to SCP-6848's nature is rendered imperceptible to human listeners. This has led researchers to believe that the object is only antimemetic within the context of the human noosphere, as it ostensibly can be perceived in full clarity by non-Earth native observers.


@@ @@

------
[[=]]
+++ Addendum 6848.1: History
[[/=]]
------

It is unknown when SCP-6848 was created or first transported to Earth, however the parascientific and parahistorical consensus now accepts that the first earthbound extraterrestrial mission relating to it was indeed the Roswell incident of Human-Zeta Reticulan first contact in July of 1947. This incident, involving the crash landing of a Zeta Reticulan spacecraft near a ranch in New Mexico, saw the recovery of the ruined craft with an intact outer ring and anti-gravity apparatus, as well as four (4) intact or partially intact Zeta Reticulan cadavers belonging to its crew, by the United States. In later correspondences with Site-51 authorities[[footnote]]See document 704-Roswell-1967[[/footnote]], emissaries claiming to belong to the Reticulan Expeditionary Alliance[[footnote]]Reticulan: "Ylgaof-ssdykl Hakdnanka"[[/footnote]] clarified that the ship's crew had crashed, presumably due to failure to operate (or malfunction of) their craft's anti-gravity system, in a botched landing, and did in fact possess the deliberate intention to land in New Mexico with the purpose of discovering a "Holy Ark, of great significance to our people" (presumed to be SCP-6848).

[[include :scp-wiki:component:image-features-source |hover-enlarge=--]
|enlarge-amount=8
|speed=80
|float=true
|align=right
|width=300px
|url=https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/22/Roswell_UFO_Museum_-_Alien_Autopsy_%286080682876%29.jpg/640px-Roswell_UFO_Museum_-_Alien_Autopsy_%286080682876%29.jpg
|add-caption=true
|caption=Above: Cryogenically-preserved Zeta Reticulan cadaver.
]]

Following the recovery of the destroyed Roswell craft, national governments and paranormalcy agencies initially panicked over the discovery of potentially revolutionary paratechnology. Many, including the Pentagram at the time of the crash, believed they had uncovered technology similar to that used by the Ahnenerbe Obskurakorps to create //[[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/whats-going-down |Luftplatten]]]// and other so-called "Wonder-weapons" during the Seventh Occult War and that it could be applied for eigenweapon production or enabling travel at relativistic speeds. It is also believed that American possession of new extraterrestrial technology starting in 1947 heightened Cold War tensions and accelerated the inevitable coming arms race, with Soviet premier Joseph Stalin ordering the creation of the GRU Psychotronics Division later the same year. Ultimately, recovered material proved useful in discovering other extraterrestrial anomalies and research acquired from it was in fact used in a number of paratechnology development projects such as the Pentagram's black project //[[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-4220 |Helios]]]//.

In an attempt to ease these tensions and acquire help upholding the Veil during the Roswell situation, the Department of Defense requested the aid of the Foundation, a neutral organization in the Cold War, in dealing with the recovered material and suppressing public outcry. The Foundation agreed on the condition that the recovered material and any findings made regarding it be open to the Foundation and testing by its researchers, to which the American government assented. This agreement would serve as the basis of what would eventually become Site-51 under joint supervision of the Foundation and Pentagram.

In the coming decade, SCP-6848-related incidents increased in frequency and landings of extraterrestrial craft became a common occurrence across the southwestern deserts. The areas of landing were often isolated from large cities, inhospitable, or sparsely populated, aiding in the preservation of secrecy. Nevertheless, in the 1950s and 1960s, the Foundation and the United States continued to collaborate on the construction of a number of spaceports in the area intended for commercial and military collaboration between humankind and extraterrestrial civilizations, as to place earthbound landing sites for interplanetary activity and inquiry into SCP-6848 under the jurisdiction of normalcy-preserving authorities capable of regulating commercial, personal, and military interplanetary travel between terrestrial and alien parties. 

As a base of operations for control of these ports and for the reverse-engineering of extraterrestrial paratechnology more broadly, Site-51 was constructed in 1955, greatly increasing the Foundation's administrative ability to control spaceflight to and from Earth and reducing the number of associated normalcy risks and containment breaches.

@@ @@

------
[[=]]
+++ Addendum 6848.2: Record of SCP-6848-related Incidents
[[/=]]
------

[[div class="blockquote"]]

**DATE:** 19 January 2018

**PARTIES PRESENT:** 
* Galvin Chu, researcher, Department of Paratechnology
* Doug McCarthy, major general, Pentagram
* Agnes Hartmann, ambassador, Department of Extraterrestrial Relations

------

@@ @@

[[=]]
[EXTRANEOUS INFORMATION REMOVED]
[[/=]]

**CHU:** ...So //that's// really it? Not even the Foundation knows what aliens want with the New Mexico desert?

**HARTMANN:** Pretty much. Well, every group we meet has a different thing they seem to be looking for...

**MCCARTHY:** Agnes, show the new guy the 6848 instance log.

**HARTMANN:** Oh, yeah. This will help you get it.

**HARTMANN:** Every species -- every individual alien culture, honestly -- has their own assumption for what SCP-6848 is. It seems like a sort of galactic or universal cultural constant; everyone seems to view it as some incredibly important artifact uniquely significant to them, only us Earthlings can't percieve it at all for some reason.

**CHU:** Does that make us unique and special in some way, or just uniquely inadequate?

**MCCARTHY:** I'd give it about a 50/50 shot either way.

**HARTMANN:** Yup, pretty much. Anyways, every species or group's collective consciousness -- at least that's what noospherics seems to think is what's going on -- comes up with its own identity for this thing, right? Here's an example.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="blockquote"]]
**Engaging Party:** GoI-1995 ("Alliance Organization of Sirius and the Pleiades")

**Identity:** An alliance composed of formal governmental organizations in the Alpha Canis Majoris system and the Pleiades cluster. One of the most amicable and well-known alliances in the galaxy, possessing relations with many other extraterrestrial civilizations. Combats Draconian expansion and influence from the less legitimate organizations in the area, such as those engaged in smuggling and organized crime. Relations with the Foundation are mostly amicable, although GoI-1995 occasionally comes into conflict with the (also nominally Foundation-allied) Zeta Reticulan research conglomerates, causing a point of tension.

**SCP-6848 Association:** Many Sirian and Pleiadian oral traditions report of a great, wise beast buried deep beneath the ground on a distant world at the approximate location of Earth. GoI-1995 has expressed interest in locating this entity, which they believe to be the identity of SCP-6848. Site-51 has mostly greenlit these operations, but they have thusfar proven unsuccessful.
[[/div]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
**CHU:** What exactly does our alliance with them entail?

**HARTMANN:** Mostly economic; trade deals and the like. Their main enemies are too far for supplying military aid to be reasonable or helpful given our capabilities, so we don't worry about it much. Kind of like Terzan-2's war with the Twelve Stars, if you read about that in the memo.

**CHU:** There's no conflict of interest with those Reticulan conglomerates you guys mentioned?

**HARTMANN:** My department pulled that off recently. Got the Grey research cells to allow friendly Sirian and Pleiadian traffic to pass through their channels in exchange for resource guarantees and permits to refuel their mining operations at Foundation facilities on Mars. We had to ship a //lot// of material from Cave Creek Port.

**MCCARTHY:** Hold on, you can do that without Pentagram authorization?

**HARTMANN:** That's the deal. You guys share your homework on experimental aircraft testing, and we bring the resources and expertise to hold the fort down so nothing explodes and nobody makes a mess. 

**HARTMANN:** And, with all due respect, diplomacy has always been more //our// strongsuit than yours.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="blockquote"]]
**Engaging Party:** GoI-2235 ("88th Antarean Expeditionary Regiment")

**Identity:** An independent paramilitary originating around Antares in the Scorpius constellation but operating locally to Earth, including in the Sol, Sirius, and Centaurian systems as well as around Barnard's Star in Ophiuchus. Appears to have its own unclear agenda, occasionally conflicting with Foundation and/or Pentagram interests.

**SCP-6848 Association:** During communications initiated with Site-51 in 1982, GoI-2235 stated it had discovered a stolen mothership harbored on Earth and demanded the object be handed over. A blundered response was interpereted as aggression and, according to extraterrestrial informants, the group began readying craft for an invasion of Earth. This incident, known as the 1982 McCarthy-Antares crisis, was averted diplomatically after aid was provided by the nominally Foundation-aligned Zeta Reticulan Sol Research Conglomerate urged GoI-2235 not to initiate aggression, warning of Earth's eigenweapon capability and a potential backlash from Reticulan business interests should they be negatively affected.
[[/div]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
**MCCARTHY:** My father, by the way. Named for my father. He oversaw the crisis, not me.

**HARTMANN:** Don't sweat it, Doug. That's why we have ambassadors now.

**MCCARTHY:** Don't fucking try me. I've got exclusive sarcasm rights here. Worked hard for 'em, just like my father, and his before him.

**HARTMANN:** Oh, get over it. 
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="blockquote"]]
**Engaging Party:** GoI-5129 ("Alpha Canis Majoris High Admiralty")

**Identity:** Independent spacefaring organization based in the Sirius system. Believed to be in search of occult artifacts, with the Foundation's extraterrestrial affiliates reporting a reputation of looting objects from other civilizations. For unknown reasons, spacecraft bear near-exact resemblance to human sea vessels. Possibly affiliated with the Church of Scientology's Sea Organization.

**SCP-6848 Association:** A number of earthbound missions in the area of SCP-6848 have been attributed to GoI-5129 in search of various items. Often mentioned is a "starforged grail shaped of Uron-leusan's hands" capable of "holding the Pleiades within as any other chalice holds wine"[[footnote]]Believed to be lost in translation. No extraterrestrial civilization of which the Foundation is aware has been known to distill alcohol for recreational consumption.[[/footnote]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
**CHU:** Alien pirates?

**MCCARTHY:** Not the weirdest thing you'll hear. They gave the Navy hell for a while in the '90s, actually. Kept popping up along the west coast with plasma cannons and crap; honestly, part of me thinks they were //trying// to just waste our resources. We got McCain to call in his [[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/new-atlantis |Atlantean friends]]] and everything, and even that was only barely enough to deter them.

**CHU:** Excuse me, Atlantis?

**HARTMANN:** Shit.

**MCCARTHY:** Not for his security clearance?

**HARTMANN:** For his Foundation credentials, no it's not.

**MCCARTHY:** Christ's sake. In the Pentagram, even first day recruits know about Atlantis. Free goddamn country on our side of things.

**HARTMANN:** Whatever, I'll get on with it.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="blockquote"]]
**Engaging Party:** PoI-2934 ("Ashtar Sheran")

**Identity:** Individual capable of telepathic contact of interstellar distances. Believed to be an extremely powerful psion; possibly also a deific entity. Allegedly based in the Pleiades star cluster. Some reports place PoI-2934 as the charismatic and dictatorial commander of a militaristic organization named in their likeness, the "Ashtar Galactic Command" -- the truth of this is unclear.

**SCP-6848 Association:** From 1966 to 1970, PoI-2934 was the suspected perpetrator of a mass psionic incursion upon human beings -- victim counts are estimated around 4-10 thousand. Affected individuals recieve visions of a so-called "Christ consciousness particle" buried beneath the American southwest under conspiratorial circumstances. Some affected individuals form what is now known as GoI-8823-D ("Research Center for Heavenly Vibrations") -- initially suspected to be a standard countercultural movement, the Center's true nature as an aggressive and militant cult was made clear with a series of attacks upon US government facilities in the late 1960s, sparking a guerilla war against the Pentagram which lasted an additional two years before full surrender.
[[/div]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
**MCCARTHY:** This bastard's been meddling in our affairs a long time. Mind hacked a bunch of hippies in the '60s despite that psi-shield you guys //insisted// worked.

**CHU:** You might be referring to the Cayce-class telepathy inhibitors? Yeah, paratech is never perfect and they certainly weren't then.

**HARTMANN:** I heard the GOC might have a working version of the model nowadays? 

**CHU:** Maybe. Numbers for unwanted telepathic contact have been suspiciously down recently; that's true. Still a better option than coating the entire planet in telekill, so I wouldn't be surprised if they kept their project going, but ours got way too expensive.

**HARTMANN:** I see. 

**CHU:** Anyhow, that actually explains a lot about the '60s.
[[/div]]

@@ @@


[[div class="blockquote"]]
**HARTMANN:** One last thing on the agenda for today, and then you'll have been briefed on everything you need to know.

**HARTMANN:** Dr. Chu, are you familiar with the UAP sightings made by the USS //Nimitz// Carrier Strike Group in 2004?

**MCCARTHY:** The grainy black and white videos that made the rounds online last year. Shit resolution, flying tic-tacs? Ring a bell?

**CHU:** Yes, of course. I suppose they were looking for 6848? A lower-risk case, since we presumably published them to distract the conspiracists?

**MCCARTHY:** Essentially, but that isn't the full story. The crafts weren't unknown.

**HARTMANN:** Open the next addendum, McCarthy. Let him read it for himself.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

------
[[=]]
+++ Addendum 6848.3: Project //Shipwreck// Debrief
[[/=]]
------

**Background:** On 14 November 2004, the Pentagram detected an unknown target off the west coast of the United States. Closer inspection revealed multiple objects, with Pentagram officers identifying them as unidentified aerial craft of seemingly artificial extraterrestrial origin, prompting Site-51 authorities to be contacted. Airborne objects were round, elongated, and white in coloration, composed of an unknown material. Entirely smooth, they showed no external markings and possessed no signs of a conventional propulsion system. Objects appeared to display the ability to become intangible at will and were able to accelerate to relativistic speeds almost instantaneously from a state of zero acceleration. 

Crafts were attacked by Pentagram battleships and fighter jets, though proved incredibly resilient and remained mostly intact after being shot down into the ocean. Site-51 authorities requested the recover of the partially damaged craft for it to be brought to the site, studied and reverse-engineered, to which Pentagram command assented.

@@ @@

[[include component:image-block
    name=https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c6/USS_Nimitz_%28CVN-68%29_returning_to_Norfolk_1981.JPEG/640px-USS_Nimitz_%28CVN-68%29_returning_to_Norfolk_1981.JPEG |
    caption=Above: USS //Nimitz// aircraft carrier. |
    align=center |
    width=100%
]]

**Project Aim:** Project //Shipwreck// was the joint initiative between the Foundation and Department of Defense Pentagram at Site-51 to manufacture reverse-engineered anomalous aircraft from advanced extraterrestrial vessels recovered in 2004 and utilize said vessels to locate and identify SCP-6848.

//Shipwreck// was initially intended as purely a reverse-engineering mission for scientific and military application. It was only upon the discovery by Site-51's paratechnology office that piloting of the recovered vehicles required uploading of the consciousness to a secure network onboard the craft, thereby temporarily isolating oneself from the human noosphere, that their use as a means to identify or locate SCP-6848 was considered. 

[[include :scp-wiki:component:image-features-source |hover-enlarge=--]
|enlarge-amount=8
|speed=80
|float=true
|align=right
|width=40%
|url=https://i.imgur.com/vh1w00o.png
|add-caption=true
|caption=Above: Frame from the fabricated footage disseminated by Site-51.
]]

Once a sufficient understanding of the technology was attained and a working aircraft constructed, it was planned to outfit said craft with a camera system, utilize a human test subject as pilot, and upload said subject's consciousness to the craft, at which point it was theorized their consciousness would no longer be considered human and would prove capable of mentally rendering SCP-6848. From this point, the subject would be instructed to fly the craft toward SCP-6848, activating on-demand intangibility if necessitated.

By 2016, an effective model based off of the recovered craft had been devised and a number of prototypes produced. The produced model demonstrated all conventional capabilities expected, but did not conceptualize SCP-6848 upon insertion of a human intelligence. As such, Project //Shipwreck// has been deemed complete and Project //Dockyard// has been instantiated to determine possible flaws in the previous hypotheses regarding SCP-6848 such that the issue of reverse-engineering a conceptualization of the object can later be revisited.

Despite the project's nominal failure for its intended purpose, //Shipwreck// was later approved by Site-51's Disinformation and Misinformation authorities as a favorable candidate for conspiracization disinfo procedures. In 2017, Disinformation personnel facilitated the production of faked footage using reverse-engineered crafts, releasing it to the Veiled population through a secure civilian cover under the false explanation that they were recordings depicting the sighting of unidentified aerial phenomena by the crews of the Navy aircraft carriers USS //Nimitz// and USS //Theodore Roosevelt// at varying points in 2004, 2014, and 2015. This disinformation campaign proved successful, with the majority of the population defaulting to the authority of official investigations promised by the US government on the matter of aerial phenomena following the publication of the footage. Also in line with disinformation goals, those members of the civilian population who did not do such were successfully portrayed as conspiracists and largely discredited.

@@ @@

  --timeScale: 1.5;
  --timeDelay: 1.5s;
  --posX: calc(50% - 358px - 13rem);
  --fnLinger: 1s;
}
 
#page-content hr {
    background-color: #000;
}
 
#page-content tr th {
    padding: 6px;
    border: #000 1px solid;
}
 
#page-content tr td {
    padding: 12px;
    border: #000 1px solid;
    line-height: 1.4;
}
 
#page-content .sidebox tr td, 
#page-content .sidebox tr th {
    padding: 0.35em;
}
 
#side-bar {
    border-right: 1px solid #333;
    background: #DDD;
}
 
#side-bar .side-block {
    border: 1px solid #333;
    border-radius: 0;
    box-shadow: none;
}
 
#top-bar div.open-menu a {
    border: 1px solid #333;
    border-radius: 0;
    box-shadow: none;
}
 
@media (max-width: 767px) {
    #side-bar:target {
        border: 1px black;
        box-shadow: none;
    }
}
 
#side-bar .side-block {
    border: 1px solid #333;
    border-radius: 0;
    box-shadow: none;
    background-color: #FDF6D7;
}
#side-bar .side-block.media {
    background-color:#D7EFE7;
}
#side-bar .side-block.resources {
    background-color:#F5D8E0;
}
 
#page-content .creditRate{
    margin: unset;
    margin-bottom: 4px;
}
#page-content .rate-box-with-credit-button {
    background-color: #ffffff;
    border: solid 1px #000;
    box-shadow: none;
    border-radius: 0;
}
 
#page-content .rate-box-with-credit-button .fa-info {
    border: none;
    color: #333333;
}
 
#page-content .rate-box-with-credit-button .fa-info:hover {
    background: #333333;
    color: #ffffff;
}
 
.rate-box-with-credit-button .cancel {
    border: solid 1px #ffffff;
}
 
/* ---- PAGE RATING ---- */
 
.page-rate-widget-box {
    box-shadow: none;
    border: solid 1px #000;
    margin: unset;
    margin-bottom: 4px;
    border-radius: 0;
}
 
div.page-rate-widget-box .rate-points {
    background-color: #ffffff;
    color: #333333;
    border: none;
    border-radius: 0;
}
.page-rate-widget-box .rateup,
.page-rate-widget-box .ratedown {
    background-color: #ffffff;
    border-top: none;
    border-bottom: none;
}
 
.page-rate-widget-box .rateup a,
.page-rate-widget-box .ratedown a {
    background: transparent;
    color: #333333;
}
 
.page-rate-widget-box .rateup a:hover,
.page-rate-widget-box .ratedown a:hover {
    background: #333333;
    color: #ffffff;
}
 
.page-rate-widget-box .cancel {
    background: transparent;
    background-color: #ffffff;
    border: none;
    border-radius: 0;
}
 
.page-rate-widget-box .cancel a {
    color: #333333;
}
.page-rate-widget-box .cancel a:hover {
    background: #333333;
    color: #ffffff;
    border-radius: 0;
}
#page-content .rate-box-with-credit-button .page-rate-widget-box { border: none; }
 
.anchor {
    position: sticky;
    height:0;
    top: 0;
}
.sidebox {
    padding: .14rem;
    margin-top: 0;
    margin-bottom: 8px;
    width: calc((100vw - 870px)/2);
    max-height: calc(100vh - 18rem);
    position: absolute;
    top: 0;
    left: 103.5%;
    z-index: 5;
    overflow: auto;
    box-sizing: border-box;
}
@media (max-width: 1290px) {
    .sidebox {
        display: none;
        visibility: hidden;
    }
 
    #header h2::before {
        font-size: 0.9em !important;
    }
}
 
.scp-image-block {
    box-shadow: none;
}
 
/* ---- YUI TAB BASE ---- */
.yui-navset .yui-nav a,.yui-navset .yui-navset-top .yui-nav a{background-color:inherit;background-image:inherit}.yui-navset .yui-nav a:hover,.yui-navset .yui-nav a:focus{background:inherit;text-decoration:inherit}.yui-navset .yui-nav .selected a,.yui-navset .yui-nav .selected a:focus,.yui-navset .yui-nav .selected a:hover{color:inherit;background:inherit}.yui-navset .yui-nav,.yui-navset .yui-navset-top .yui-nav{border-color:inherit}.yui-navset li{line-height:inherit}
 
/* ---- YUI TAB CUSTOMIZATION ----*/
 
 .yui-navset .yui-nav,
 .yui-navset .yui-navset-top .yui-nav{
     display: flex;
     flex-wrap: wrap;
     width: calc(100% - .125rem);
     margin: 0 auto;
     border-color: #333333;
     box-shadow: none;
}
 .yui-navset .yui-nav a, /* ---- Link Modifier ---- */
 .yui-navset .yui-navset-top .yui-nav a{
     color: #333333;
    /* ---- Tab Background Colour | [UNSELECTED] ---- */
     background-color: #efefef;
     border: unset;
     box-shadow: none;
     box-shadow: none;
}
 .yui-navset .yui-nav a:hover,
 .yui-navset .yui-nav a:focus{
     color: #ffffff;
    /* ---- Tab Background Colour | [HOVER] ---- */
     background-color: #333333;
}
 .yui-navset .yui-nav li, /* ---- Listitem Modifier ---- */
 .yui-navset .yui-navset-top .yui-nav li{
     position: relative;
     display: flex;
     flex-grow: 2;
     max-width: 100%;
     margin: 0;
     padding: 0;
     color: #ffffff;
     background-color: #ffffff;
     border-color: transparent;
     box-shadow: none;
}
 .yui-navset .yui-nav li a,
 .yui-navset-top .yui-nav li a,
 .yui-navset-bottom .yui-nav li a{
     display: flex;
     align-items: center;
     justify-content: center;
     width: 100%;
}
 .yui-navset .yui-nav li em{
     border: unset;
}
 .yui-navset .yui-nav a em,
 .yui-navset .yui-navset-top .yui-nav a em{
     padding: .35em .75em;
 
     text-overflow: ellipsis;
     overflow: hidden;
     white-space: nowrap;
}
 .yui-navset .yui-nav .selected, /* ---- Selection Modifier ---- */
 .yui-navset .yui-navset-top .yui-nav .selected{
     flex-grow: 2;
     margin: 0;
     padding: 0;
    /* ---- Tab Background Colour | [SELECTED] ---- */
     background-color: #333333;
}
 .yui-navset .yui-nav .selected a,
 .yui-navset .yui-nav .selected a em{
     border: none;
}
 .yui-navset .yui-nav .selected a{
     width: 100%;
     color: #ffffff;
}
 .yui-navset .yui-nav .selected a:focus,
 .yui-navset .yui-nav .selected a:active{
     color: #ffffff;
     background-color: #333333;
}
 .yui-navset .yui-content {
    background-color: #ffffff;
    box-shadow: none;
}
 .yui-navset .yui-content,
 .yui-navset .yui-navset-top .yui-content{
    padding: .5em;
    border: 1px solid #333;
    box-sizing: border-box;
}
 
/*---- SCROLLBAR ----*/
 
::-webkit-scrollbar {
    width: 10px;
}
 
::-webkit-scrollbar-track {
    background: #FFF;
    border-left: 1px solid #333;
}
 
::-webkit-scrollbar-thumb {
     background: #CCC;
     border: #333 1px solid;
}
 
::-webkit-scrollbar-thumb:hover {
     background: #EEE;
}
 
/*---- CENTER IMAGES ON MOBILE courtesy of EstrellaYoshte and PeppersGhost ----*/
 
.imagediv {
    float: right;
    margin: 15px
}
 
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  .imagediv {
    float: none;
    text-align:center;
    margin: auto;
  }
}
 
@media only screen and (max-width: 600px) {
    .scp-image-block.block-right{
        float: none;
        margin: 10px auto;
    }
}
 
/*---- ACS-COLORED TABLE DIVS ----*/
 
#page-content .table1 tr th,
#page-content .table1 .scp-image-block .scp-image-caption {
    background-color: #D7EFE7;
}
 
#page-content .table2 tr th,
#page-content .table2 .scp-image-block .scp-image-caption {
    background-color: #D8ECF4;
}
 
#page-content .table3 tr th,
#page-content .table3 .scp-image-block .scp-image-caption {
    background-color: #FDF6D7;
}
 
#page-content .table4 tr th,
#page-content .table4 .scp-image-block .scp-image-caption {
    background-color: #FFDABF;
}
 
#page-content .table5 tr th,
#page-content .table5 .scp-image-block .scp-image-caption {
    background-color: #F5D8E0;
}
 
#page-content .table6 tr th,
#page-content .table6 .scp-image-block .scp-image-caption {
    background-color: rgba(146, 0, 255, 0.2);
}
 
.tableb .wiki-content-table {
    border-collapse: separate;
    border-spacing: 2px;
}
 
.tableb .scp-image-block {
    border: none;
}
 
.tableb .scp-image-block img {
    border: #000 1px solid;
    box-sizing: border-box;
}
 
.tableb .scp-image-block .scp-image-caption {
    margin-top: 2px;
    border: #000 1px solid;
    box-sizing: border-box;
}
 
.top-left-box > .item {
  display: none;
}
 
/* ---- WORDS NO LONGER BROKEN, THE CROQUEMBOUCHE HAS SPOKEN ---- */
span, a { word-break: normal !important }
 
.avatar-hover { display: none !important; }
 
#breadcrumbs, .pseudocrumbs {
    text-align: center;
    padding-top: 10px;
}
 
#main-content .page-tags span {
    max-width: 100%;
}
 
/* -- FANCY THINGS from Woedenaz's Dustjacket Theme -- */
 
.fancyhr hr {
    border-top: 2vw solid transparent;
    background-color: rgba(var(--bright-accent), 0);
    height: 0;
    box-sizing: border-box;
    border-image-source: url('https://wanderers-library.wikidot.com/local--files/component:dustjacket-theme/wl_hr.png');
    border-image-repeat: round round;
    background: none;
    border-image-slice: 80 500 80 500 fill;
    border-image-width: 10em 80em 10em 80em;
}
 
.fancyborder {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    border: 2vw solid rgba(0,0,0,0.5);
    border-image: url('https://wanderers-library.wikidot.com/local--files/component:dustjacket-theme/wl_border.png') 600 round;
    border-image-width: 6;
    padding: 2vw;
}

[[module CSS]]
/* Flopstyle: LITE
 * [2020 Wikidot Theme]
 * Created by Lt Flops
 * Select CSS Styles Are Credited Where Necessary
 * -- (CC BY-SA 3.0) --
**/

/* -------- TOP-BAR -------- */
 #search-top-box,
 #top-bar,
 #login-status{
     right: 0;
}
 #top-bar ul li ul{
     top: 22px;
}
 #search-top-box-form input[type="submit"]{
     font-size: unset;
}
 #search-top-box-input,
 #search-top-box-form input[type="submit"]{
     background-color: hsl(0, 0%, 20%);
     background-image: none;
     border-color: hsl(0, 0%, 60%);
     border-radius: 0;
}
 #search-top-box-input:hover,
 #search-top-box-input:focus,
 #search-top-box-form input[type="submit"]:hover,
 #search-top-box-form input[type="submit"]:focus{
     background-color: hsl(0, 0%, 30%);
     background-image: none;
     border-color: hsl(0, 0%, 70%);
}
 #top-bar .open-menu a{
     border-radius: unset;
     border-width: .1em;
}
 
/* -------- SIDE-BAR -------- */
 #side-bar .side-block{
     border-color: hsl(0, 0%, 20%);
     border-radius: 0;
}
 #side-bar .heading{
     color: hsl(0, 0%, 5%);
     border-bottom: solid 1px hsl(0, 0%, 20%);
}
 
/* -------- SIDEBOXES --------
 * By EstrellaYoshte
 * Adapted From 'Penumbra Theme'
**/
 .anchor{
     position: -webkit-sticky;
     position: sticky;
     top: 0;
 
     z-index: 5;
}
 .authorbox,
 .sidebox{
     position: absolute;
     width: calc((100vw - 870px) / 2);
     max-height: calc(100vh - 18rem);
     margin-right: 8px;
     padding: .3em 1.64em;
 
     box-sizing: border-box;
 
     z-index: 5;
}
 .authorbox{
     top: .5em;
     right: 103.5%;
     max-width: calc((100vw - 921.2px) / 2) !important;
     padding-right: 1em;
 
     font-size: 95%;
}
 .sidebox{
     left: 103.5%;
     margin-left: 1em;
     padding-left: 1em;
 
     background: hsl(0, 0%, 100%);
     border: 1px solid hsl(0, 0%, 73%);
     border-left: 8px solid var(--accentColor);
}
 .authorbox tr th,
 .authorbox tr td,
 .sidebox tr th,
 .sidebox tr td{
     padding: .25em !important;
}
 .flavorbox{
     width: 75%;
     margin: auto auto 5px;
     padding: 0 1em;
 
     border: 1px solid #888;
}
 
/* -------- Sidebox Mobile Optimization Courtesy of Woedenaz -------- */
 .limit{
     line-height: 1.5;
     z-index: 5;
}
 .limit br{
     display: block;
}
 @media (max-width: 1280px){
     .sidebox{
         width: auto;
         max-width: 65vw !important;
         top: .75rem;
         right: calc(((100vw - 45.8rem) / 2) * -1);
         left: initial;
         padding: 0 .4rem;
 
         background-color: var(--accentColor);
         border: 1px solid hsl(0, 0%, 73%);
         border-left: 8px solid var(--accentColor);
         border-radius: 0;
 
         overflow: visible;
         -webkit-clip-path: inset(-.125rem -.25rem 0 calc(100% - 1.275rem));
         clip-path: inset(-.125rem -.25rem 0 calc(100% - 1.275rem));
         -webkit-transition:
            color .2s ease-in-out .1s,
            -webkit-box-shadow .5s ease-in-out .1s,
            -webkit-clip-path .5s ease-in-out .1s;
         transition:
            color .2s ease-in-out .1s,
            -webkit-box-shadow .5s ease-in-out .1s,
            -webkit-clip-path .5s ease-in-out .1s;
         -o-transition:
            color .2s ease-in-out .1s,
            box-shadow .5s ease-in-out .1s,
            clip-path .5s ease-in-out .1s;
         transition:
            color .2s ease-in-out .1s,
            box-shadow .5s ease-in-out .1s,
            clip-path .5s ease-in-out .1s;
         transition:
            color .2s ease-in-out .1s,
            box-shadow .5s ease-in-out .1s,
            clip-path .5s ease-in-out .1s,
            -webkit-box-shadow .5s ease-in-out .1s,
            -webkit-clip-path .5s ease-in-out .1s;
    }
     .sidebox::before,
     .sidebox::after{
         content: " ";
         position: absolute;
         right: 0;
    }
     .sidebox::before{
         width: 0;
         height: 0;
         top: calc(50% - .75rem);
 
         border-top: .75rem solid transparent;
         border-bottom: .75rem solid transparent;
         border-right: .75rem solid var(--accentColor);
 
         z-index: 10;
         transition: border .1s ease-in-out .1s;
    }
     .sidebox::after{
         width: 100%;
         max-width: .75rem;
         height: 100%;
         max-height: calc(100vh - 18rem);
         top: 0;
 
         background-color: hsl(0, 0%, 100%);
 
         z-index: -1;
         transition:
            box-shadow .5s ease-in-out .1s,
            max-width .5s ease-in-out .1s;
    }
     .sidebox > *{
         opacity: 0;
         -webkit-transition: opacity .2s ease-in-out .2s;
         -o-transition: opacity .2s ease-in-out .2s;
         transition: opacity .2s ease-in-out .2s;
    }
     .sidebox:hover{
         overflow: visible;
         -webkit-clip-path: inset(-.125rem -.25rem 0 0);
         clip-path: inset(-.125rem -.25rem 0 0);
         -webkit-transition:
            color .5s ease-in-out .2s,
            right .5s ease-in-out .1s,
            -webkit-clip-path .5s ease-in-out .1s,
            -webkit-box-shadow .5s ease-in-out .1s;
         transition:
            color .5s ease-in-out .2s,
            right .5s ease-in-out .1s,
            -webkit-clip-path .5s ease-in-out .1s,
            -webkit-box-shadow .5s ease-in-out .1s;
         -o-transition:
            color .5s ease-in-out .2s,
            right .5s ease-in-out .1s,
            clip-path .5s ease-in-out .1s,
            box-shadow .5s ease-in-out .1s;
         transition:
            color .5s ease-in-out .2s,
            right .5s ease-in-out .1s,
            clip-path .5s ease-in-out .1s,
            box-shadow .5s ease-in-out .1s;
         transition:
            color .5s ease-in-out .2s,
            right .5s ease-in-out .1s,
            clip-path .5s ease-in-out .1s,
            box-shadow .5s ease-in-out .1s,
            -webkit-clip-path .5s ease-in-out .1s,
            -webkit-box-shadow .5s ease-in-out .1s;
    }
     .sidebox:hover::before{
         border-top: 0 solid transparent;
         border-bottom: 0 solid transparent;
    }
     .sidebox:hover::after{
         max-width: 100%;
         right: 0;
    }
     .sidebox:hover > *{
         opacity: 1;
    }
}
 @media (max-width: 768px){
     .sidebox,
     .sidebox:hover{
         right: calc(((100vw - (100% - 3rem)) / 2) * -1 + 1rem);
    }
}
 @media (max-width: 1280px){
     .authorbox{
         display: none;
         visibility: hidden;
    }
}
 
/* -------- GENERAL -------- */
 :root{
   --accentColor: hsl(0, 100%, 30%);
   --vivid-lime-green: hsl(112, 77%, 48%);
}
 body{
     color: hsl(0, 0%, 5%);
 
     word-break: unset;
}
 #search-top-box-input,
 #search-top-box-input:hover,
 #search-top-box-input:focus,
 #search-top-box-form input[type=submit],
 #search-top-box-form input[type=submit]:hover,
 #search-top-box-form input[type=submit]:focus,
 #top-bar ul li ul,
 #side-bar .side-block,
 .page-rate-widget-box,
 .scp-image-block{
     box-shadow: none;
}
 
/* -------- COLLAPSIBLES -------- */
 .collapsible-block-link {
     font-size: 120%;
     font-weight: bold;
}
 
/* Licensebox Collapsible */
 .licensebox {
     text-align: center;
}
 
 .licensebox blockquote,
 .licensebox div.blockquote {
     text-align: left;
}
 
/* -------- INFO BAR -------- */
 body {
     --barColour: hsl(0, 89%, 18%);
}
 
 .u-faq {
     display: none;
}
 
 .info-container .collapsible-block-link {
     font-size: 100%;
}
 
 .info-container div.collapsible-block-content {
     padding: 0 .5em 30px;
}
 
 .info-container div.collapsible-block-content .wiki-content-table,
 .footer-wikiwalk-nav .collapsible-block .wiki-content-table {
     width: 90%;
}
 
/* -------- INFO PANE -------- */
 .creditRate{
     margin-right: 0 !important;
}
 .rate-box-with-credit-button{
     border-radius: 0 !important;
     box-shadow: none !important;
}
 .creditButton p a:hover,
 .creditButtonStandalone p a:hover{
     color: var(--vivid-lime-green) !important;
}
 div.credit.first .wiki-content-table {
     width: 100%;
}
 
/* -------- PAGE RATING -------- */
 .page-rate-widget-box{
     margin-right: 0;
}
 .page-rate-widget-box,
 div.page-rate-widget-box .rate-points{
     border-radius: 0;
}
 .page-rate-widget-box .cancel,
 .page-rate-widget-box .cancel a:hover{
     border-radius: 0 !important;
}
 
/* -------- FORMATTING | [GENERAL] -------- */
 #page-content h1,
 #page-content h2,
 #page-content h3,
 #page-content h4,
 #page-content h5,
 #page-content h6{
     display: flex;
     flex-direction: column;
     justify-content: center;
     margin-bottom: .57em;
 
     line-height: 1.2;
     text-align: center;
     text-underline-offset: 25%;
     word-break: unset;
}
 hr{
     height: 0;
     margin: 1em 0;
 
     background-color: transparent;
     border-top: 1px solid hsl(0, 0%, 67%);
}
 
 ol li{
     margin: 0 0 1em;
}
 ul{
     margin:1em 0;
}
 li, p{
     line-height: 1.5;
     text-underline-offset: 30%;
}
 .footnotes-footer, .bibitems{
     padding: 0 0 .5em;
}
 
/* -------- IMAGE BLOCK -------- */
.scp-image-block .scp-image-caption{
     font-size: 95%;
     line-height: 1.35;
     text-underline-offset: 30%;
}
 .scp-image-block.block-right{
     margin: 0 0 1em 2em;
}
 
/* -------- CUSTOM DIV BLOCKS -------- */
 .raisa-header, .pink-header,
 .oracle-header, .cicapoco-header{
     margin-bottom: 1em;
     padding: 0 .5em;
 
     text-align: center;
}
 
 .raisa-header{ /* ---- RAISA Notice Header ---- */
     background: hsl(60, 65%, 85%);
     border: 1px solid hsl(0, 0%, 60%);
}
 
 .pink-header{ /* ---- Pretty Header ---- */
     background: hsl(350, 100%, 85%);
     border: 1px solid hsl(0, 4%, 36%);
}
 .pink-header hr{
     border-color: hsl(0, 4%, 36%);
}
 
 .oracle-header{ /* ---- SPC's 'From the Desk of ORACLE' Header ---- */
     color: hsl(208, 100%, 97%);
     background: hsl(208, 67%, 44%);
     border: 1px solid hsl(0, 0%, 5%);
}
 .oracle-header hr{
     border-color: hsl(208, 100%, 97%);
}
 .img-resize img{ /* ---- Header Icons (See Example Formatting) ---- */
     float: left;
     width: auto;
     height: 8em;
     margin: .5em;
}
 
 .cicapoco-header{   /* ---- SPC's RAISA-Equivalent Header ---- */
     background: lightblue;
     border: 1px solid hsl(195, 50%, 39%);
}
 .cicapoco-header hr{
     border-color: hsl(195, 50%, 39%);
}
 
 .content-warning{   /* ---- Content Warning ---- */
     width: 75%;
     margin: 1rem auto;
     padding: 0 1rem;
 
     background: white;
     border: 3px double black;
 
     text-align: center;
}
 
 blockquote, /* ---- Regular Quote Block ---- */
 div.blockquote{
     background-color: hsl(0, 0%, 96%);
     border: 3px double hsl(0, 0%, 60%);
}
 blockquote table.wiki-content-table th,
 div.blockquote table.wiki-content-table th{
     background-color: hsl(0, 0%, 89%);
}
 
 .alt-blockquote{ /* ---- Alternative Quote Block ---- */
     margin: 1em 0;
     padding: 0 1em;
 
     background-color: hsl(0, 0%, 96%);
     border: 1px solid hsl(0, 0%, 60%);
     border-radius: 1em;
}
 
 .lightweight{ /* ---- Lightweight Quote Block ---- */
     margin: 1em 3em;
     padding: 0 1em;
 
     background-color: hsl(0, 0%, 90%);
 
     text-align: left;
}
 
 .card-block{ /* ---- Decorative Quote Block ---- */
     margin: 1em 0;
     padding: .6em 1.2em;
 
     background: hsl(220, 15%, 93%);
     border-left: 8px solid var(--accentColor);
     border-radius: .48em;
}
 
 blockquote hr, div.blockquote hr, .alt-blockquote hr, .lightweight hr, .card-block hr{
     border-color: hsl(0, 0%, 67%);
}
 
 .log-header{ /* ---- Interview/Exploration Log Header ---- */
     margin-bottom: 1em;
     padding: 0 1em;
 
     background: hsl(0, 0%, 96%);
     border: 3px dashed hsl(0, 0%, 60%);
     border-radius: 2em;
}
 
 .report-box{ /* ---- Report Block ---- */
     margin: 1em 0;
     padding: 0 1em;
 
     background-color: hsl(0, 0%, 100%);
     border: medium solid hsl(0, 0%, 5%);
}
 .report-box hr{
     border-color: hsl(0, 0%, 5%);
}
 
 .realistic-shadow{ /* ---- Better Shadows ---- */
     margin: 1em 0 2em 0;
     box-shadow:
          0 1px 1px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, .23),
          0 2px 2px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, .18),
          0 4px 4px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, .15),
          0 8px 8px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, .13);
}
 
 .report-box.red-tint{ /* ---- Alternative Report Block Variants ---- */
     background-color: hsl(360, 91%, 86%);
     border-color: hsl(360, 62%, 66%);
}
 .report-box.red-tint hr{
     border-color: hsl(360, 62%, 66%);
}
 
 .report-box.orange-tint{
     background-color: hsl(30, 91%, 86%);
     border-color: hsl(30, 62%, 66%);
}
 .report-box.orange-tint hr{
     border-color: hsl(30, 62%, 66%);
}
 
 .report-box.yellow-tint{
     background-color: hsl(60, 91%, 86%);
     border-color: hsl(60, 62%, 66%);
}
 .report-box.yellow-tint hr{
     border-color: hsl(60, 62%, 66%);
}
 
 .report-box.green-tint{
     background-color: hsl(120, 91%, 86%);
     border-color: hsl(120, 62%, 66%);
}
 .report-box.green-tint hr{
     border-color: hsl(120, 62%, 66%);
}
 
 .report-box.cyan-tint{
     background-color: hsl(180, 91%, 86%);
     border-color: hsl(180, 62%, 66%);
}
 .report-box.cyan-tint hr{
     border-color: hsl(180, 62%, 66%);
}
 
 .report-box.blue-tint{
     background-color: hsl(240, 91%, 86%);
     border-color: hsl(240, 62%, 66%);
}
 .report-box.blue-tint hr{
     border-color: hsl(240, 62%, 66%);
}
 
 .report-box.magenta-tint{
     background-color: hsl(300, 91%, 86%);
     border-color: hsl(300, 62%, 66%);
}
 .report-box.magenta-tint hr{
     border-color: hsl(300, 62%, 66%);
}
 
 .report-box.grey-tint{
     background-color: hsl(210, 9%, 86%);
     border-color: hsl(210, 15%, 42%);
}
 .report-box.grey-tint hr{
     border-color: hsl(210, 15%, 42%);
}
 
 .report-box.red-tint blockquote hr, .report-box.red-tint div.blockquote hr,
 .report-box.orange-tint blockquote hr, .report-box.orange-tint div.blockquote hr,
 .report-box.yellow-tint blockquote hr, .report-box.yellow-tint div.blockquote hr,
 .report-box.green-tint blockquote hr, .report-box.green-tint div.blockquote hr,
 .report-box.cyan-tint blockquote hr, .report-box.cyan-tint div.blockquote hr,
 .report-box.blue-tint blockquote hr, .report-box.blue-tint div.blockquote hr,
 .report-box.magenta-tint blockquote hr, .report-box.magenta-tint div.blockquote hr,
 .report-box.grey-tint blockquote hr, .report-box.grey-tint div.blockquote hr{
     border-color: hsl(0, 0%, 67%);
}
 
 div.o5-box{ /* ---- Overseer Document Block ---- */
     margin: 1em 6em;
     padding: 0 1em;
 
     background-color: hsl(0, 0%, 75%);
     border: medium solid hsl(0, 0%, 5%);
}
 div.o5-box hr{
     border-color: hsl(0, 0%, 5%);
}
 
 .faux-source{ /* ---- Mimics "Page Source" Appearance ---- */
     margin-bottom: 1em;
     padding: 0 2em;
 
     background-color: hsl(0, 0%, 100%);
     border: 1px dashed hsl(0, 0%, 67%);
 
     font-family: var(--mono-font);
}
 
 .narration{ /* ---- Mimics the Pages of a Book ---- */
     margin: 1em 0;
     padding: 0 1em;
 
     background-color: hsl(0, 0%, 100%);
     border: 1px solid hsl(0, 0%, 63%);
}
 
 .warning-notice{ /* ---- Simple Warning Block (Adapted From 'SCP-3143') ---- */
     padding: 0 1em;
 
     background-color: hsl(0, 0%, 100%);
     background-image: url(https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/scp-style-resource/scp_trans.png);
     background-position: center;
     background-repeat: no-repeat;
     border: medium solid hsl(0, 0%, 5%);
 
     text-align: center;
}
 .warning-notice hr{
     border-color: hsl(0, 0%, 5%);
}
 
 .journal{ /* ---- Journal Block (Adapted From 'SCP-4003') ---- */
     margin: 1em 0;
     padding: .9em;
 
     background-image:
       linear-gradient(to top,
          hsl(201, 33%, 84%) 0%,
          hsl(60, 29%, 89%) 8%);
     background-position: 0 8px;
     background-size: 100% 1.3rem;
     border: 1px solid hsl(0, 0%, 80%);
     border-radius: .9em;
 
     font-family: "Architects Daughter", cursive;
}
 .journal p{
     margin: 0;
 
     font-size: 1.3rem;
     line-height: 1.3rem;
}
 
 .sms-message{ /* ---- SMS Message Block ---- */
     float: left;
     clear: left;
     width: 22.4em;
     margin: 0 0 1em;
     padding: 0 1.2em;
 
     background: hsl(0, 0%, 75%);
     border-radius: 2em;
 
     font-size: 112.5%;
     text-align: center;
}
 
 blockquote .collapsible-block-folded,
 .alt-blockquote .collapsible-block-folded,
 .lightweight .collapsible-block-folded,
 .card-block .collapsible-block-folded,
 .report-box .collapsible-block-folded,
 .o5-box .collapsible-block-folded,
 .narration .collapsible-block-folded,
 .journal .collapsible-block-folded,
 div.blockquote .collapsible-block-folded{
     /* ---- For Collapsibles Inside Divs | [CLOSED] ---- */
     padding: .75em 0;
     /* -------- */
}
 blockquote .collapsible-block-unfolded,
 .alt-blockquote .collapsible-block-unfolded,
 .lightweight .collapsible-block-unfolded,
 .card-block .collapsible-block-unfolded,
 .report-box .collapsible-block-unfolded,
 .o5-box .collapsible-block-unfolded,
 .narration .collapsible-block-unfolded,
 .journal .collapsible-block-unfolded,
 div.blockquote .collapsible-block-unfolded{
     /* ---- For Collapsibles Inside Divs | [OPEN] ---- */
     padding-top: .75em;
     /* -------- */
}
 
/* -------- FORMATTING | [SPECIAL] -------- */
 .centered{ /* ---- Center-Aligns Text ---- */
     text-align: center;
}
 
 .justified{ /* ---- Justify-Aligns Text ---- */
     text-align: justify;
}
 
 .indented{ /* ---- Indents Block by ½-inch/2em (Use Within Other Divs) ---- */
     text-indent: 2.4em;
}
 
 .indented .bibcite,
 .indented .bibitems,
 .indented .footnoteref,
 .indented .footnotes-footer,
 .indented .scp-image-block,
 .indented h1, .indented h2, .indented h3,
 .indented h4, .indented h5, .indented h6,
 .indented .image-container,
 .indented ol,
 .indented ul,
 .indented .centered{
     text-indent: 0;
}
 
 .rev-red, .rev-green, .rev-blue, .rev-yellow, .terminal-span{
     font-weight: bold;
}
 
 .rev-red{ /* ---- Red Document Revision Text ---- */
     color: hsl(360, 100%, 27%);
}
 
 .rev-green{ /* ---- Green Document Revision Text ---- */
     color: hsl(120, 100%, 27%);
}
 
 .rev-blue{ /* ---- Blue Document Revision Text ---- */
     color: hsl(240, 100%, 27%);
}
 
 .rev-yellow{ /* ---- Yellow Document Revision Text ---- */
     color: hsl(40, 100%, 40%);
}
 
 .terminal-span{ /* ---- Computer Terminal Text ---- */
     font-family: var(--mono-font);
     font-size: 110%;
     letter-spacing: .3px;
}
 
/* ---- Blinking Text Cursor (Adapted From 'Your Very First SCP!') ---- */
 .blinkbar{color: black; animation: blink 1.5s infinite;}
 @keyframes blink{to{opacity: .0;}}
 @keyframes flicker{0% {opacity: .9890; }5% {opacity: .5842; }10% {opacity: .9865; }20% {opacity: .0412; }20% {opacity: .6255; }25% {opacity: .3157; }30% {opacity: .7328; }35% {opacity: .4654; }40% {opacity: .9128; }45% {opacity: .2449; }50% {opacity: .5485; }55% {opacity: .6438; }60% {opacity: .1180; }65% {opacity: .9085; }70% {opacity: .0266; }75% {opacity: .6795; }80% {opacity: .7812; }85% {opacity: .0117; }90% {opacity: .2239; }95% {opacity: .8897; }100% {opacity: .2260; }}
 @keyframes overlay-anim{0% {visibility: hidden; }10% {visibility: hidden; }11% {visibility: visible; }50% {visibility: hidden; }100% {visibility: hidden; }}
 
 .lite-heading{ /* ---- Special Heading Area (Adapted From 'SCP-4058') ---- */
     clear: both;
     margin: 3.6em auto;
}
 .lite-heading h3{
     color: hsl(360, 100%, 27%);
}
 .lite-heading hr{
     width: 55%;
     margin: auto;
 
     border-width: medium;
}
 
 div.image-showcase{ /* ---- Alternative Image Showcase ---- */
     width: 25em;
     margin-bottom: 1em;
 
     background: hsl(0, 0%, 100%);
     border: 3px ridge hsl(0, 0%, 5%);
}
 div.image-showcase.block-center{
     margin-right: auto;
     margin-left: auto;
}
 
 .scene-break{ /* ---- Fancy Scene/Section Break ---- */
     width: 3.5em;
     margin: 2em 0;
}
 
 .listPagesNav{ margin-bottom: 5em; }
 .listPagesNav-prev, /* ---- ListPages Navigation (Adapted from 'SCP-5552') ---- */
 .listPagesNav-next{
     width: 45%;
     margin: 0 0 1em;
     padding: 0 2%;
 
     background: hsl(0, 0%, 90%);
     border: 1px solid hsl(0, 0%, 60%);
}
 .listPagesNav-prev{
     float: left;
     text-align: left;
}
 .listPagesNav-next{
     float: right;
     text-align: right;
}
 
 .fade-away{
     background: linear-gradient(to bottom, hsl(0, 0%, 95%), hsl(0, 0%, 5%));
}
 
 .footing::before{ /* ---- Page Footing ---- */
     content: " ";
     position: absolute;
     bottom: 1px;
     left: 0;
     right: 0;
 
     border-bottom: 2px solid hsl(0, 0%, 47%);
}
 .footing{
     position: relative;
     bottom: -2px;
     margin-bottom: 2px;
 
     border-bottom: 1px solid hsl(0, 0%, 47%);
}
 
 .related-flex{ /* ---- Related Articles Box ---- */
     display: flex;
     justify-content: center;
}
 .related{
     margin: 1em 0;
     padding: 0 1em;
 
     background-color: hsl(0, 0%, 100%);
     border: thick solid hsla(0, 0%, 60%, 0.5);
 
     text-align: left;
}
 
 .series-nav{ /* ---- Series Navigation ---- */
     margin: .5em 0;
 
     background:
       linear-gradient(to bottom right,
          hsla(0, 0%, 100%, 1),
          hsla(0, 0%, 50%, .5));
     border: outset 1.5px hsl(0, 0%, 5%);
     border-radius: 2em;
 
     font-size: 85%;
     font-weight: bold;
     text-align: center;
}
 
/* -------- ADVANCED WARNING HEADER --------
 * Adapted From 'SCP-001-JP - indonootoko's Proposal'
 * See the Example at the Top of the Page
**/
 .orderwrapper{
     position: relative;
     width: auto;
 
     text-align: center;
}
 .council{
     position: relative;
     top: 0;
     bottom: 0;
     left: 0;
     right: 0;
     width: 295px;
     height: 295px;
     margin: auto;
 
     background-image: url(https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/scp-style-resource/scp_trans.png);
     background-position: center;
     background-repeat: no-repeat;
     background-size: 295px 295px;
}
 .ordertitle{
     position: absolute;
     top: 27px;
     left: 0;
     right: 0;
}
 .ordertitle h1{
     color: hsl(0, 0%, 5%);
 
     font-size: 220%;
     line-height: 90%;
}
 .orderdescription{
     position: absolute;
     top: 93px;
     left: 0;
     right: 0;
     width: 100%;
}
 .orderdescription h1{
     color: hsl(0, 0%, 5%);
 
     font-size: 120%;
}
 .orderdescription p{
     color: hsl(0, 0%, 5%);
 
     font-size: 90%;
}
 .itemno{
     position: absolute;
     bottom: 18px;
     left: 0;
     right: 0;
}
 .itemno h1{
     color: hsl(0, 0%, 5%);
 
     font-size: 170%;
}
 
/* -------- YUI TAB BASE -------- */
 .yui-navset .yui-nav a,.yui-navset .yui-navset-top .yui-nav a{background-color:inherit;background-image:inherit}.yui-navset .yui-nav a:hover,.yui-navset .yui-nav a:focus{background:inherit;text-decoration:inherit}.yui-navset .yui-nav .selected a,.yui-navset .yui-nav .selected a:focus,.yui-navset .yui-nav .selected a:hover{color:inherit;background:inherit}.yui-navset .yui-nav,.yui-navset .yui-navset-top .yui-nav{border-color:inherit}.yui-navset li{line-height:inherit}
 
/* -------- YUI TAB CUSTOMIZATION --------
 * Adapted From 'Black Highlighter Theme'
**/
 .yui-navset *{
     transition:
          color 80ms cubic-bezier(.4, 0, .2, 1),
          background-color 80ms cubic-bezier(.4, 0, .2, 1);
}
 .yui-navset .yui-nav,
 .yui-navset .yui-navset-top .yui-nav{
     display: flex;
     flex-wrap: wrap;
     width: calc(100% - .125rem);
     margin: 0 auto;
 
     border-color: hsl(360, 94%, 20%);
     box-shadow: 0 calc(.0625rem * 5) 0 0 hsl(360, 94%, 20%);
}
 .yui-navset .yui-nav a, /* ---- Link Modifier ---- */
 .yui-navset .yui-navset-top .yui-nav a{
     color: hsl(0, 0%, 5%);
     /* ---- Tab Background Colour | [UNSELECTED] ---- */
     background-color: hsl(0, 0%, 99%);
     /* -------- */
     background-image: none;
     border: unset;
}
 .yui-navset .yui-nav a:hover,
 .yui-navset .yui-nav a:focus{
     color: hsl(0, 0%, 96%);
     /* ---- Tab Background Colour | [HOVER] ---- */
     background-color: hsl(360, 100%, 27%);
     /* -------- */
}
 .yui-navset .yui-nav li, /* ---- Listitem Modifier ---- */
 .yui-navset .yui-navset-top .yui-nav li{
     position: relative;
     display: flex;
     flex-grow: 2;
     max-width: 100%;
     margin: 0;
     padding: 0;
 
     background-color: hsl(0, 0%, 96%);
     border-color: transparent;
     box-shadow: 0 0 0 .0625rem hsl(360, 94%, 20%);
}
 .yui-navset .yui-nav li a,
 .yui-navset-top .yui-nav li a,
 .yui-navset-bottom .yui-nav li a{
     display: flex;
     align-items: center;
     justify-content: center;
     width: 100%;
}
 .yui-navset .yui-nav li em{
     border: unset;
}
 .yui-navset .yui-nav a em,
 .yui-navset .yui-navset-top .yui-nav a em{
     padding: .35em .75em;
 
     text-overflow: ellipsis;
     overflow: hidden;
     white-space: nowrap;
}
 .yui-navset .yui-nav .selected, /* ---- Selection Modifier ---- */
 .yui-navset .yui-navset-top .yui-nav .selected{
     flex-grow: 2;
     margin: 0;
     padding: 0;
 
     /* ---- Tab Background Colour | [SELECTED] ---- */
     background-color: hsl(360, 94%, 20%);
     /* -------- */
}
 .yui-navset .yui-nav .selected a,
 .yui-navset .yui-nav .selected a em{
     border: hsl(360, 94%, 20%);
}
 .yui-navset .yui-nav .selected a{
     width: 100%;
 
     color: hsl(0, 0%, 96%) !important;
     background-image: none;
}
 .yui-navset .yui-nav .selected a:focus,
 .yui-navset .yui-nav .selected a:active{
     color: hsl(0, 0%, 96%);
     background-color: hsl(360, 94%, 20%);
}
 .yui-navset .yui-nav .selected a:hover{
     cursor: default;
}
 .yui-navset-left .yui-content{
     /* ---- Content Background ---- */
     background-color: hsl(0, 0%, 99%);
     /* -------- */
}
 .yui-navset .yui-content,
 .yui-navset .yui-navset-top .yui-content{
     padding: .5em;
     border-color: hsl(0, 0%, 60%);
}
 
/* -------- PAGE TAGS -------- */
 #main-content .page-tags{
     border-top: 1px solid hsl(0, 0%, 73%);
}
 #main-content .page-tags a{
     display: inline-block;
     height: .8125rem;
     margin: 0 0 .5rem .75rem;
     padding: .1875rem .3125rem .1875rem 0;
 
     color: hsl(0, 0%, 95%);
     background-color: hsl(0, 0%, 27%);
     border-bottom-right-radius: .25rem;
     border-top-right-radius: .25rem;
 
     line-height: 13px;
     line-height: .8125rem;
     font-size: 11px;
     font-size: .6875rem;
     font-weight: normal;
}
 #main-content .page-tags a:before{
     width: 0;
     height: 0;
     top: -.1875rem;
     left: -.625rem;
     padding: 0 .0625rem .1875rem;
 
     border-color: transparent hsl(0, 0%, 27%) transparent transparent;
     border-style: solid;
     border-width: .5rem .5rem .5rem 0;
}
 #main-content .page-tags a:before,
 #main-content .page-tags a:after{
     content: "";
     position: relative;
     float: left;
}
 #main-content .page-tags a:after{
     width: .25rem;
     height: .25rem;
     top: .2813rem;
     left: -.5rem;
 
     background-color: hsl(0, 0%, 100%);
     border-radius: .125rem;
}
 #main-content .page-tags span{
     max-width: 100%;
     border-top: .5rem solid transparent;
}
 
/* -------- WIKIWALK NAVIGATOR -------- */
 .footer-wikiwalk-nav {
    text-align: center;
}
 
/* -------- INTERWIKI -------- */
 div.scpnet-interwiki-wrapper{
     margin-bottom: 2rem;
}
 iframe.scpnet-interwiki-frame{
     width: 17.75em;
     min-height: 4.25em;
     margin-left: 4px;
 
     background: hsl(127, 050%, 94%);
     border: 1px solid hsl(0, 0%, 20%);
}
 #interwiki body{
     overflow: hidden;
}
 #interwiki .side-block{
     padding: 5px;
 
     background: 0;
     border: 0;
     box-shadow: none;
}
 #interwiki .heading{
     color: hsl(0, 0%, 5%);
     border-bottom: 1px solid hsl(0, 0%, 20%);
}
 #interwiki .menu-item img{
     display: none;
}
 
/* -------- SHOW-CHANGES HIGHLIGHTS -------- */
 .inline-diff ins::before{
     color: hsl(240, 100%, 93%);
}
 .inline-diff del::before{
     color: hsl(0, 100%, 90%);
}
 .inline-diff ins + del::before,
 .inline-diff del + ins::before{
     color: transparent;
}
 .inline-diff br + ins::before,
 .inline-diff br + del::before,
 .inline-diff ins:first-of-type::before,
 .inline-diff del:first-of-type::before{
     position: absolute;
     display: inline-block;
     left: -1em;
 
     content: "\f111";
     font: normal normal normal 16px/1 "FontAwesome";
     text-rendering: auto;
     -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;
     -moz-osx-font-smoothing: grayscale;
}
 
/* -------- PRESENTATION -------- */
 .templateInfo{
     margin: 1em 0;
     padding: 0 1em;
     background: hsl(0, 0%, 100%);
     border: 1px solid hsl(0, 0%, 87%);
}
 
/* -------- CROQSTYLE ALTERATIONS -------- */
 #edit-page-textarea{ font-family: unset; }
 tt{
     background-color: unset;
     font-size: unset;
     padding: unset;
     margin: unset;
     border-radius: unset;
}
 
/* ---- BETTERFOOTNOTES PATCH ---- */
 :root{
     --posX: calc(50% - 358px - 13rem) !important;
     --fnLinger: 1.5s !important;
}
 .fnnum{
     font-size: 90%;
}
 .fnnum:hover + .fncon{
     right: calc(-8vw - 4rem) !important;
}
 
/* -------- REDUCED MOTION ACCESSIBILITY -------- */
 @media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce){
     *, *::before, *::after{
          animation-duration: .001s !important;
          animation-iteration-count: 1 !important;
          transition-duration: .001s !important;
    }
}
 
/* -------- MOBILE MEDIA QUERY -------- */
 @media (max-width: 479px){
     #header h1 a{
          font-size: 85%;
    }
     div.image-showcase{
          width: 90%;
    }
     div.o5-box{
          margin: 1em 0;
    }
}
 
/* -------- NOTE MEDIA QUERY -------- */
 @media (min-width: 480px) and (max-width: 580px){
     #header h1 a{
          font-size: 100%;
    }
     div.image-showcase{
          width: 100%;
    }
     div.o5-box{
          margin: .5em;
    }
}
 
/* -------- MINI TABLET MEDIA QUERY -------- */
 @media (min-width: 581px) and (max-width: 767px){
     #header h1 a{
          font-size: 120%;
    }
}
 @media (max-width: 767px){
     .open-menu a:hover{
          box-shadow: none;
    }
}
 
/* -------- TABLET MEDIA QUERY -------- */
 @media (min-width: 768px) and (max-width: 979px){
     #header h1 a{
          font-size: 140%;
    }
}
[[/module]]
[[include :scp-wiki:component:acs-animation]]
author: Ampyrsand
